TopicTitle: Professor Kerbenstein's wonderous vertical propulsion emporium.

Articles.Content:
No idea if something like this has been mentioned already, but heres an idea.

Alternative to the solar panels, heat conductive panels that face the sun, with small water-pipes running around the back-side of the panel. Heated water then goes to a small steam-powered motor to create electrickery.

No idea if something like this has been mentioned already, but heres an idea.

Alternative to the solar panels, heat conductive panels that face the sun, with small water-pipes running around the back-side of the panel. Heated water then goes to a small steam-powered motor to create electrickery.

I like the concept, i will see if i can make something happen, thankyou

I like the concept, i will see if i can make something happen, thankyou

No problem! I am a fan of steampunk designs, and I've been silently following this mod.

One more idea for thicker landing legs, I feel a design like this one (behold my super-crude 10-minute modelling and animation) might fit in with the steampunk look.
want want want want want want want want want want antn anw nan tn an nawn tasgffaf NOW!

want want want want want want want want want want antn anw nan tn an nawn tasgffaf NOW!

i belieby i see antonov somewhere here.

...

Anyways - those heat conducted panels would be great addition. Hmm.... there should be some steam engine which then generates a random resource called "rotary power" and wheels that use this power!

No problem! I am a fan of steampunk designs, and I've been silently following this mod.

One more idea for thicker landing legs, I feel a design like this one (behold my super-crude 10-minute modelling and animation) might fit in with the steampunk look.

so many ideas... bigger parts, space station stuff, more varieties of landing gear/wheels etc...
